description:
“Diversity has generated better strategy, better risk management, better debates and better outcomes.” Alan Joyce, CEO.

Qantas isn’t just Australia’s largest airline, it also has the longest history. Founded in 1920, Qantas now carries more than 52 million passengers safely to their destinations a year.

CEO Alan Joyce is a vocal supporter of workplace diversity. In 2017, he was named a Companion of the Order of Australia (AC) for his contributions to gender equity, inclusion and diversity, and as a supporter of Indigenous education. He is also co-patron of ACON’s national not-for-profit program for LGBTI workplace inclusion, Pride in Diversity.

                                           ​

Qantas has a long history and demonstrated commitment to ensuring the participation of women both across the organisation and in leadership roles. Over the years, Qantas has introduced a range of initiatives designed to promote equity, inclusion and diversity. They include:

Aspire and Inspire

The Aspire and Inspire programs are targeted development workshops for talented female employees. The workshops address some of the workplace challenges that are specific to women, with the aim of supporting them and nurturing their talent. 

Women’s Employee Network: Altitude

Altitude is the name of the Qantas Women’s Employee Network. It was developed by employees, for employees and promotes a gender diverse and inclusive workplace. The network creates a space for women across the group to connect, support and share experiences. A number of sub-networks have also been establis hed, including a Women in IT network.

​

                                        

Flex@Q

The purpose of Flex@Q is to create a culture and workplace where people can work flexibly, helping employees balance their work and personal lives. Because flexibility means different things to different people, Qantas says the starting point of Flex@Q is a conversation.

MyLife Hub

MyLife Hub is a wellness portal that provides self-service access across all stages and ages of life. It provides practical support in a range of areas, such as finding a day care centre, school or aged care facility, wellness planning tools, nutritional information, stress management and tips on returning to work.
